    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div>
      <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr valign="top">
            <td style="WIDTH: 36pt; TEXT-ALIGN: right">
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: text-top">(1)</font></font></div>
            </td>
            <td>
              <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Reimbursement
      of these costs are both subject to a cap and adjusted downward should
      actual expenses incurred be less than the payments
      received.&#160;&#160;Aircraft ownership reimbursements under the CRJ-900
      DCA are based on principal and interest payments on debt associated with
      each aircraft.</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr></table>
    </div>
    <div>
      <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr valign="top">
            <td style="WIDTH: 36pt; TEXT-ALIGN: right">
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: text-top">&#160;(2)</font></font></div>
            </td>
            <td>
              <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Ground handling and airport
      facilities are provided free of charge unless our partner asks us to
      perform ground handling in a station.&#160;&#160;In these instances, we
      are compensated based upon negotiated ground handling
      rates</font>.</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr></table>
    </div>
    <div>
      <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr valign="top">
            <td style="WIDTH: 48px; TEXT-ALIGN: right">
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: text-top">&#160;(3)</font></font></div>
            </td>
            <td width="933">
              <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Landing fees that we incur in
      Detroit are reimbursed directly.&#160;&#160;All other landing fees in our
      CRJ-200 operation are rate- based.&#160;&#160;In addition, in certain
      cities under our CRJ-200 ASA, Delta provides or arranges for ground
      handling services on our behalf.&#160;&#160;Our costs for these ground
      handling services, which include most other facility costs, are capped
      under the CRJ-200 ASA.</font></font></div>
            </td>
          </tr></table>
    </div><br>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">8</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
      </div>
    </div><br>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -1pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Item
1.&#160; Business</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -1pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Our
Operating Contracts (Continued)</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Revenue Pro-rate
Agreements.</font>&#160;&#160;In addition to the Continental CPA, Colgan
operates under contracts structured as revenue pro-rate code-share agreements,
which allow for Colgan to market its operations under its partners&#8217;
brands.&#160; Under these agreements, Colgan generally manages its own inventory
of unsold capacity and sets fare levels in the local markets that it
serves.&#160;&#160;Colgan retains all of the revenue for passenger flying within
Colgan&#8217;s local markets and not connecting to its partners&#8217;
flights.&#160;&#160;For connecting passengers, the passenger fare is pro-rated
between Colgan and its major airline partner, generally based on the distance
traveled by the passenger on each segment of the passenger&#8217;s trip or on a
comparison of unrestricted local fares within each segment.&#160; Under these
agreements, Colgan bears the risk associated with fares, passenger demand, and
competition within its markets.&#160;&#160;Colgan incurs all of the costs
associated with operating these flights, including those costs typically
reimbursed or paid directly by the major airline under a capacity purchase
agreement. In some instances, Colgan has the ability to earn incentive-based
revenue should it achieve specified performance metrics.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Colgan&#8217;s
revenue pro-rate agreement with Continental is a modified pro-rate agreement in
that it also contains a connecting passenger incentive designed to maintain a
base level of revenue in the Houston markets that Colgan serves.&#160;&#160;The
connect incentive can be a payment from or a payment to Continental, depending
on certain variables such as load factors, and is designed to create a more
stable revenue level in these markets than could otherwise be supported under a
traditional revenue pro-rate agreement.&#160;&#160;The connect incentives rates
are adjusted twice a year for changes in fuel prices and certain
station/passenger related costs.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Colgan&#8217;s
revenue pro-rate agreement with United is also a modified pro-rate agreement in
that it includes a fixed connecting passenger incentive payment designed to
subsidize some of the markets that Colgan operates in as United
Express.&#160;&#160;These markets would not be profitable on a stand-alone basis
without the connecting passenger incentive.&#160;&#160;The incentive amount is
fixed for the three-year term of the agreement and may only be adjusted upon the
concurrence of both Colgan and United.&#160;&#160;Colgan has the ability to exit
these markets to the extent that the markets can no longer be operated
profitably with the fixed connecting passenger incentive payment.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In
addition to operating its flights under revenue pro-rate code-share agreements,
Colgan also operates some flights within its revenue pro-rate networks under
Essential Air Service (&#8220;EAS&#8221;) contracts with the Department of Transportation
(&#8220;DOT&#8221;).&#160;&#160;The EAS program provides a federal government subsidy within
certain small markets that could not otherwise sustain commercial air service
because of limited passenger demand.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><a name="Item1PinnaclesAgreements">Pinnacle&#8217;s Agreements with Major
Airlines</a></font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -1pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">CRJ-200
Airline Services Agreement</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -1pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Pinnacle
provides regional jet service to Delta operating 126 50-seat CRJ-200 aircraft
under the CRJ-200 ASA.&#160;&#160;At the end of its term in 2017, the CRJ-200
ASA automatically extends for additional five-year periods unless Delta provides
notice to us two years prior to the termination date that it does not plan to
extend the term.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -1pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In
addition to the rate-based and reimbursed payments previously detailed, our
CRJ-200 ASA with Delta provides for margin payments.&#160;&#160;The current
rate-based payments will be in effect (subject to indexed annual inflation
adjustments) through the end of 2012, when a negotiated rate reset will occur,
which is designed to adjust our rate based compensation to cover our actual
costs at that time.<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">&#160;</font>We receive a monthly
margin payment based on the payments described above calculated to achieve a
target operating margin of 8%. Delta does not guarantee Pinnacle&#8217;s minimum
operating margin, although we are subject to a margin ceiling above the target
operating margin.&#160;&#160;If Pinnacle&#8217;s actual operating margin related to
its operations under the CRJ-200 ASA for any year exceeds the 8% target
operating margin but is less than 13%, Pinnacle will make a year-end adjustment
payment to Delta in an amount equal to half of the excess above
8%.&#160;&#160;If Pinnacle&#8217;s actual operating margin for any year exceeds 13%,
Pinnacle will pay Delta all of the excess above 13%.&#160;&#160;&#160;Margin
calculations under the CRJ-200 ASA exclude amounts recognized as deferred ASA
revenue, which is discussed in detail in Note 3, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Code-Share Agreements</font>, in
Item 8 of this Form 10-K.</font></div><br>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">9</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
      </div>
    </div><br>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -1pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Item
1.&#160; Business</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Pinnacle&#8217;s
Agreements with Major Airlines (Continued)</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -1pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
CRJ-200 ASA provides that we will be required to negotiate with Delta an
adjustment to our rates to the extent that we establish operations with another
major airline.&#160;&#160;Under the CRJ-200 ASA, upon reaching a certain level
of operations outside of our CRJ-200 ASA, and to the extent that we have
realized operating cost efficiencies from combining overhead in such outside
operations, we will negotiate a rate reduction to the fixed payment that we
receive under our CRJ-200 ASA related to our overhead.&#160;&#160;We have
discussed our current level of operations outside the CRJ-200 ASA with Delta,
and in early 2010, we reached a tentative agreement to provide for a prospective
rate reduction of $2 million in 2010 and $2.5 million in 2011, and $2.5 million
in 2012 under this provision of the CRJ-200 ASA.&#160;&#160;We do not expect
this provision to result in further adjustments to our contract billings prior
to our rate reset effective at the end of 2012.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">To the
extent that Pinnacle operates regional jets on behalf of another major airline,
Delta may remove one aircraft for every two aircraft that Pinnacle operates for
another partner above an initial base of 20 regional jets.&#160;&#160;Delta may
remove no more than 20 aircraft subject to this option and no more than five
aircraft in any 12-month period.&#160;&#160;Delta may only exercise this option
if the removed aircraft are not operated by or on behalf of Delta after their
removal.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -1pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Delta may
terminate the CRJ-200 ASA at any time for cause.&#160;&#160;Delta may also
terminate the agreement at any time upon our bankruptcy or for any breach of the
agreement by us that continues uncured for more than 30 days after we receive
notice of the breach.&#160;&#160;However, in the case of a non-monetary default,
Delta may not terminate the agreement if the default would take more than 30
days to cure and we are diligently attempting to cure the default.&#160;&#160;In
addition, both Delta and we are entitled to seek an injunction and specific
performance for a breach of the agreement.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -1pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In
general, we have agreed to indemnify Delta and Delta has agreed to indemnify us
for any damages caused by any breaches of our respective obligations under the
CRJ-200 ASA or caused by our respective actions or inaction under the CRJ-200
ASA.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">We
recently reached a tentative agreement with Delta entered to resolve various
other issues related to the CRJ-200 ASA.&#160;&#160;These issues and their
resolution are discussed in greater detail in Note 3, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Code-Share Agreements</font>, in
Item 8 of this Form 10-K.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">CRJ-900
Delta Connection Agreement (&#8220;CRJ-900 DCA&#8221;)</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Pinnacle
provides regional jet service to Delta operating 76-seat CRJ-900 aircraft under
the CRJ-900 DCA.&#160;&#160;The CRJ-900 DCA provides that Pinnacle operate 16
CRJ-900 aircraft under a capacity purchase agreement.&#160;&#160;The CRJ-900 DCA
allows Delta the option to add an additional seven CRJ-900 aircraft to the
fleet.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
CRJ-900 DCA provides for Delta to pay pre-set rates based on the capacity we
provide to Delta.&#160;&#160;We are responsible for the costs of flight crews,
maintenance, dispatch, aircraft ownership and general and administrative
costs.&#160;&#160;In addition, Delta reimburses us for certain pass-through
costs, including landing fees, most station-related costs (to the extent that we
incur them) and aircraft hull and general liability insurance.&#160;&#160;In
most instances, Delta will provide fuel and ground handling services free of
charge.&#160;&#160;We earn incentive payments (calculated as a percentage of the
payments received from Delta) if we meet certain performance
targets.&#160;&#160;The CRJ-900 DCA also provides for reimbursements to Delta
annually to the extent that our actual pre-tax margin on our Delta Connection
operations exceeds certain thresholds.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
CRJ-900 DCA terminates for each aircraft upon the tenth anniversary of the
in-service date of such aircraft.&#160;&#160;Upon the sixth anniversary of the
agreement date, which is April 27, 2013, either party has the right under the
CRJ-900 DCA to remove from the terms of the agreement up to 20% of the CRJ-900
aircraft each year thereafter.</font></div><br>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">10</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
      </div>
    </div><br>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -1pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Item
1.&#160; Business</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Pinnacle&#8217;s
Agreements with Major Airlines (Continued)</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">To the
extent that either party materially breaches the CRJ-900 DCA and such breach
remains uncured for a period of 30 days, the non-breaching party may terminate
the agreement.&#160;&#160;In addition, Delta may temporarily suspend or
terminate the CRJ-900 DCA in the event of certain force majeure events that
prevent either party from performing its obligations under the CRJ-900
DCA.&#160;&#160;Delta may also terminate the CRJ-900 DCA upon certain corporate
transactions such as a merger or change of control involving the Company, our
failure to maintain a certain level of safety, our failure to maintain certain
specified operational performance standards, our failure to adhere to various
governmental operating regulations, our failure to maintain certain
certifications and authorities, a material breach by us of our purchase
agreement for our CRJ-900 aircraft with the manufacturer, or our failure to
maintain specified levels of insurance.&#160;&#160;Delta may also terminate the
CRJ-900 DCA if Pinnacle commences operating a fleet type that causes Delta to be
in violation of the collective bargaining agreement with its
pilots.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -1pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><a name="Item1ColgansAgreements">Colgan&#8217;s Agreements with Major
Airlines</a></font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Continental
Connection Capacity Purchase Agreement (&#8220;Continental CPA&#8221;)</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Colgan
operates 74-seat Q400 turboprop regional aircraft predominantly out of
Continental&#8217;s hub at Newark Liberty International Airport.&#160;&#160;Colgan
entered into the ten-year Continental CPA on February 5, 2007, which terminates
for each aircraft upon the tenth anniversary of the in-service date of such
aircraft.&#160;&#160;Operations began on February 4, 2008, and we currently
operate 14 Q400 aircraft under the Continental CPA.&#160;&#160;In early 2009, we
amended the Continental CPA to add an additional 15 Q400 aircraft, which are
expected to deliver between August 2010 and April 2011.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
Continental CPA provides that we are compensated at pre-set rates for the
capacity that we provide to Continental.&#160;&#160;We are responsible for our
own expenses associated with flight crews, maintenance, dispatch, aircraft
ownership and general and administrative costs.&#160;&#160;In addition,
Continental reimburses us without a markup for certain reconciled costs, such as
landing fees, most station-related costs not otherwise provided by Continental
or its designee; aircraft hull and passenger liability insurance (provided that
our insurance rates do not exceed those typically found at other Continental
regional airline partners) and passenger related costs.&#160;&#160;Continental
will also provide to Colgan at no charge fuel and ground handling services at
its stations.&#160;&#160;Continental may request that we provide ground handling
for our flights at certain stations, in which case, we will be compensated at a
predetermined rate for these ground handling services.&#160;&#160;The
Continental CPA also provides for the ability to earn additional incentive-based
revenue based upon achieving operational and financial performance
targets.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
Continental CPA provides for a rate reduction to Continental to the extent that
we begin operating Q400 aircraft for another major airline.&#160;&#160;The rate
reduction is designed to share the overhead burden associated with the Q400
aircraft across all of our potential Q400 operations and is only applicable for
the first 15 aircraft that we add with another airline.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Continental
may immediately terminate the Continental CPA following the occurrence of any
event that constitutes cause.&#160;&#160;To the extent that either party
materially breaches the Continental CPA and such breach remains uncured for a
period of 60 days, the non-breaching party may terminate the
agreement.&#160;&#160;Continental may also terminate the CPA upon certain
corporate transactions such as a merger or change of control involving the
Company, our failure to maintain a certain level of safety, our failure to
maintain certain specified operational performance standards, or our failure to
maintain various governmental certifications and to comply with various
governmental operating regulations and authorities.</font></div><br>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">11</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
      </div>
    </div><br>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -1pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Item
1.&#160; Business</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -1pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Colgan&#8217;s
Agreements with Major Airlines (Continued)</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Continental
Connection Pro-Rate Agreement</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">We
operate 12 Saab 340 aircraft based in Houston, Texas under a code-share
agreement with Continental (the &#8220;Continental Agreement&#8221;).&#160;&#160;Colgan
entered into the Continental Agreement in January 2005 for a term of five
years.&#160;&#160;The Continental Agreement is structured as a modified pro-rate
agreement for which we receive all of the fares associated with local passengers
and an allocated portion of the connecting passengers&#8217; fares.&#160;&#160;We pay
all of the costs of operating the flights, including sales and distribution
costs.&#160;&#160;However, we also receive connect incentive payments from
Continental for passengers connecting from Colgan operated flights to any
flights operated by Continental or its other code-share partners at
Houston/George Bush Intercontinental Airport.&#160;&#160;The connect incentive
payments are designed to maintain a base level of profitability in the markets
that we fly out of Houston, and can result in a payment to us or from us
depending on our passenger load factor in these markets.&#160;&#160;The connect
incentives are modified every six months to adjust for prospective modifications
in fuel prices and certain station expenses.&#160;&#160;We are currently in
discussions with Continental about extending and/or modifying this agreement
beyond its initial five year term, which ends in the second quarter of
2010.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">US
Airways Express Agreement</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">We
operate ten Saab 340 aircraft under a code-share agreement with US Airways (the
&#8220;US Airways Agreement&#8221;).&#160;&#160;Colgan entered into the US Airways Agreement
in 1999 to provide passenger service and cargo service under the name &#8220;US
Airways Express.&#8221;&#160;&#160;The US Airways Agreement provides us use of the US
Airways flight designator code to identify flights and fares in computer
reservations systems, permits use of logos, service marks, aircraft paint
schemes, and uniforms similar to those used by US Airways and coordinated
scheduling and joint advertising.&#160;&#160;The US Airways Agreement is
structured as a revenue pro-rate agreement for which we receive all of the fares
associated with our local passengers and an allocated portion of connecting
passengers&#8217; fares.&#160;&#160;We pay all of the costs of operating the flights,
including sales and distribution costs.&#160;&#160;We control all scheduling,
inventory and pricing for each local market we serve.&#160;&#160;The current
three-year US Airways Agreement became effective on October 1, 2005 under terms
similar to the 1999 agreement.&#160;&#160;Since the end of the three-year term
in 2008, the US Airways Agreement continues to automatically extend for multiple
six-month periods until either party provides notice to terminate.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">United
Express Agreement</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In
October 2005, Colgan entered into a code-share agreement with United to provide
services as a United Express carrier (the &#8220;United Express
Agreement&#8221;).&#160;&#160;The United Express Agreement was amended and restated
effective November 1, 2008 and expires on November 1, 2011.&#160;&#160;Colgan
currently operates 12 Saab 340 aircraft under the name &#8220;United Express.&#8221; The
United Express Agreement is structured as a modified pro-rate agreement for
which we receive all of the fares associated with local passengers and an
allocated portion of the connecting passengers&#8217; fares.&#160;&#160;In addition,
United pays us a set passenger connect incentive fee for certain of the markets
that we operate under the United Express Agreement.&#160;&#160;The passenger
connect incentive may only be adjusted during the three-year term by mutual
consent of the parties.&#160;&#160;We have the right, however, to cease serving
certain of these markets to the extent that our operations are not
profitable.&#160;&#160;We pay all of the costs of operating the flights,
including sales and distribution costs.&#160;&#160;We jointly coordinate with
United all scheduling, inventory and pricing for each local market we
serve.</font></div><br>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">12</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
      </div>
    </div><br>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -1pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Item
1.&#160; Business</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -1pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><a name="Item1Employees">Employees</a></font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -1pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">As of
December 31, 2009, we had 5,106 employees.&#160;&#160;Flight attendants and
ground operations agents included 239 and 839 part-time employees, respectively.
The part-time employees work varying amounts of time, but typically work
half-time or less. The follow table details the number of employees by company
and by group:</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>

    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -1pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Labor
costs are a significant component of airline expenses and can substantially
affect our results. Approximately 78% and 52% of Pinnacle Airlines, Inc. and
Colgan Air, Inc. employees, respectively, are represented by
unions.</font></div>

following table reflects our principal collective bargaining agreements and
their respective amendable dates:</font></div>
