          </tr></table>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Our
significant maintenance facilities are located in cities that we serve based on
market size, frequency, and location.&#160;&#160;These facilities are used for
overnight maintenance; however, Memphis and Dulles are also used during the
day.&#160;&#160;We have additional smaller maintenance facilities in Atlanta,
Georgia, Fort Wayne, Indiana and South Bend, Indiana.&#160;&#160;While the
facilities are highly utilized with an average turn around time of seven to ten
hours, we believe that our existing facilities are adequate for the foreseeable
needs of our current and growing business.&#160;&#160;As our fleet grows, we may
seek additional maintenance space in the future.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In
connection with our code-share partners, we maintain contract service agreements
with Delta, Continental, United and US Airways allowing for the use of terminal
gates, parking positions and operations space at Atlanta, Boston Detroit,
Houston, Memphis, Minneapolis/St. Paul, Newark, New York LaGuardia and
Washington Dulles airports, as well as most of the stations we serve from these
hub airports.&#160;&#160;We believe the use of the terminal gates, parking
positions, and operations space obtained from our code-share partners will be
sufficient to meet the operational needs of our business.</font></div><br>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">22</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
      </div>
    </div><br>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><a name="Item3LegalProceedings">Item 3.&#160;&#160;Legal Proceedings</a></font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Pinnacle
and Colgan are subject to certain legal actions that occur in the ordinary
course of our business. While the outcome of these actions cannot be predicted
with certainty, it is the opinion of our management, based on current
information and legal advice, that the ultimate disposition of these actions
will not have a material adverse effect on our financial statements as a
whole.&#160;&#160;For further discussion, see Note 16, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Commitments and
Contingencies</font>, in Item 8 of this Form 10-K.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">September 11, 2001
Litigation.&#160;&#160;</font>Colgan is a defendant in litigation resulting from
the September 11, 2001 terrorist attacks.&#160;&#160;The Company believes it
will prevail in this litigation; however, the Company believes that any adverse
outcome from this litigation would be covered by insurance and would therefore
have no material adverse effect on the Company&#8217;s financial position, results of
operations and cash flows.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Colgan&#160;Flight
3407</font>.&#160;&#160;On February 12, 2009, Colgan Flight 3407, operated for
Continental under the Company&#8217;s Continental CPA, crashed in a neighborhood near
the Buffalo Niagara International Airport in Buffalo, New York. All 49 people
aboard, including 45 passengers and four members of the flight crew, died in the
accident. Additionally, one individual died inside the home destroyed by the
aircraft&#8217;s impact, increasing the total fatality count to 50
individuals.&#160;&#160;Several lawsuits related to this accident have been
filed against the Company, and additional litigation is
anticipated.&#160;&#160;We carry aviation liability insurance and believe that
this insurance is sufficient to cover any liability arising from this
accident.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><a name="Item3EnvironmentalMatters">Environmental Matters</a></font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">We are
subject to regulation under various environmental laws and regulations, which
are administered by numerous state and federal agencies. In addition, many state
and local governments have adopted environmental laws and regulations to which
our operations are subject. We are, and may from time to time become, involved
in environmental matters, including the investigation and/or remediation of
environmental conditions at properties used or previously used by us. We are
not, however, currently subject to any environmental cleanup orders imposed by
regulatory authorities, nor do we have any active investigations or remediations
at this time.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><a name="Item3RegulatoryMatters">Regulatory Matters</a></font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">We are
subject to regulation under various laws and regulations which are administered
by numerous state and federal agencies, including but not limited to the FAA,
DOT and Transportation Security Administration (&#8220;TSA&#8221;).&#160;&#160;We are
involved in various matters with these agencies during the ordinary course of
our business.&#160;&#160;While the outcome of these matters cannot be predicted
with certainty, it is the opinion of our management, based on current
information and past experience, that the ultimate disposition of these matters
will not have a material adverse effect on our financial condition as a
whole.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><a name="Item4SubmissionOfMatters">Item 4.&#160;&#160;Submission of Matters to a Vote
of Security Holders</a></font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -35pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">None.</font></div><br>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">23</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
      </div>
    </div><br>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -1pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Part
II</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">
      <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><a name="Item5MarketforRegistrants">Item 5.&#160;&#160;Market for Registrant&#8217;s Common
Equity, Related Stockholder Matters and Issuer Purchases of Equity
Securities</a></font></div>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
shares of our common stock are quoted and traded on the Nasdaq Global Select
Market under the symbol &#8220;PNCL.&#8221; Our common stock began trading on November 25,
2003, following our initial public offering. Set forth below, for the applicable
periods indicated, are the high and low closing sale prices per share of our
common stock as reported by the Nasdaq Global Select Market.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>

    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">As of
February 22, 2010, there were approximately 35 holders of record of our common
stock.&#160;&#160;We have paid no cash dividends on our common stock and have no
current intention of doing so in the future.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
information under the caption &#8220;Securities Authorized for Issuance under Equity
Compensation Plans,&#8221; appearing in the Proxy Statement for our 2010 Annual
Meeting of Stockholders, to be filed with the Commission within the 120 days
after December 31, 2009, is hereby incorporated by reference.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Our
Certificate of Incorporation provides that no shares of capital stock may be
voted by or at the direction of persons who are not United States citizens
unless such shares are registered on a separate stock record. Our Bylaws further
provide that no shares will be registered on such separate stock record if the
amount so registered would exceed United States foreign ownership restrictions.
United States law currently limits to 25% the voting power in our company (or
any other U.S. airline) of persons who are not citizens of the United
States.</font></div><br>

5.&#160;&#160;Market for Registrant&#8217;s Common Equity, Related Stockholder Matters
and Issuer Purchases of Equity Securities </font></div>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><a name="Item5PerformanceGraph">Performance Graph</a></font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
following graph compares total shareholder return on the Company&#8217;s common stock
over the five-year period ending December 31, 2009, with the cumulative total
returns (assuming reinvestment of dividends) on the American Stock Exchange
Airline Industry Index and the NASDAQ Composite Index. The stock performance
graph assumes that the value of the investment in our common stock and each
index (including reinvestment of dividends) was $100 on December 31, 2004. The
graph below represents historical stock performance and it not necessarily
indicative of future stock price performance.</font></div>

          </tr><tr>
            <td valign="bottom" width="41%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;
      </font></td>
            <td colspan="2" valign="bottom" width="10%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">

            <td nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
          </tr></table>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">
      <div>
        <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr>
              <td valign="top" width="3%" style="BORDER-TOP: medium none; TEXT-ALIGN: right">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">1.</font></div>
              </td>
              <td valign="top" width="81%" style="BORDER-TOP: medium none; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Our
      target operating margin under the CRJ-200 ASA was 10% from December 1,
      2003 through December 31, 2006. Under the CRJ-200 ASA effective January 1,
      2007, Pinnacle&#8217;s CRJ-200 ASA target operating margin was reduced to 8% and
      certain significant reimbursed expenses such as fuel and aircraft rentals
      were eliminated or reduced, resulting in lower revenue, expenses and
      income. In addition, operating revenues and operating income for the years
      ended December 31, 2009, 2008 and 2007 include $23.1 million, $24.0
      million and $22.6 million, respectively, of deferred revenue recognized
      related to our Northwest bankruptcy claim.&#160;&#160;For further
      discussion of the target operating margin and deferred revenue, refer to
      Note 3, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Code-Share
      Agreements with Partners, </font>in Item 8 of this Form
    10-K.</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr><tr>
              <td valign="top" width="3%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: right">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">2.</font></div>
              </td>
              <td valign="top" width="81%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Operating
      revenues and operating income for the year ended December 31, 2007 were
      affected by the January 18, 2007 acquisition of Colgan, offset by changes
      in CRJ-200 ASA with Delta.&#160;&#160;Operating revenues and operating
      income for the years ended December 31, 2009 and 2008 were affected by
      additional revenue earned under our CRJ-900 DCA and our Continental
      CPA.&#160;&#160;We began operating under our DCA in December 2007, and we
      began operating under our Continental CPA in February 2008.&#160;&#160;For
      more information, refer to Note 3, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Code-Share
      Agreements with Partners, </font>in Item 8 of this Form
    10-K.</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr><tr>
              <td valign="top" width="3%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: right">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">3.</font></div>
              </td>
              <td valign="top" width="81%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Operating
      expenses for the years ended December 31, 2007, 2006 and 2005 were
      affected by (benefits)/charges of ($1.0 million), ($43.6 million), and
      $59.6 million, respectively, related to the bankruptcies of Northwest and
      Mesaba. For more information, refer to Note 3, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Code-Share
      Agreements with Partners, </font>in Item 8 of this Form
      10-K.&#160;&#160;In addition, operating expenses for the year ended
      December 31, 2007 were affected by the acquisition of
      Colgan.&#160;&#160;As previously mentioned, Colgan was acquired on January
      18, 2007.&#160;&#160;Operating expenses for the year ended December 31,
      2008 were affected by a $13.5 million impairment charge on Colgan&#8217;s
      goodwill and aircraft retirement costs. For more information, refer to
      Note 14, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Impairment
      and Aircraft Retirement Costs</font>, in Item 8 of this Form
      10-K.</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr><tr>
              <td valign="top" width="3%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: right">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">4.</font></div>
              </td>
              <td valign="top" width="81%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">A
      new accounting standard related to convertible debt became effective for
      and was adopted by the Company beginning January 1, 2009.&#160;&#160;This
      standard required retrospective application to the terms of instruments as
      they existed for all periods presented. As such, results for the years
      ended December 31, 2008 through 2005 have been restated to reflect the
      revised accounting requirement.&#160;&#160;For more information, see Note
      7, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Borrowings</font>,
      in Item 8 of this Form 10-K.</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr><tr>
              <td valign="top" width="3%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: right">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">5.</font></div>
              </td>
              <td valign="top" width="81%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Nonoperating
      income for the year ended December 31, 2005 includes a gain of $18.0
      million related to the repurchase of our note payable to
      Northwest.&#160;&#160;Nonoperating income for the year ended December 31,
      2008 includes a $16.8 million impairment charge on our ARS
      investments.&#160;&#160;For more information on the impairment charge on
      our ARS investments, refer to Note 6, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Investments
      and Fair Value Measurements, </font>in Item 8 of this Form
      10-K.&#160;&#160;In addition, nonoperating expense for the years ended
      December 31, 2008 and 2009 includes interest expense on the financing for
      the CRJ-900 and Q400 aircraft.&#160;&#160;For more information related to
      aircraft financing, refer to Note 7, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Borrowings,
      </font>in Item 8 of this Form 10-K.&#160;&#160;Nonoperating expense for
      the year ended December 31, 2009 includes a net gain of $3.9 million,
      primarily related to the sale of our Auction Rate Securities (&#8220;ARS&#8221;)
      portfolio, and a reduction to interest expense of $2.9 million related to
      the reversal of accrued interest on tax reserves.&#160;&#160;For more
      information, see Note 6, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Investments
      and Fair Value Measurements</font>, and Note 13, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Income
      Taxes</font>, in Item 8 of this Form 10-K.</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr><tr>
              <td valign="top" width="3%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: right">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">6.</font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="left" valign="top" width="81%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Income
      tax expense for the year ended December 31, 2009 includes a benefit of
      $13.6 million related to the settlement of the Internal Revenue Service&#8217;s
      examination of the Company&#8217;s federal income tax returns for calendar years
      2003, 2004, and 2005.&#160;&#160;For more information, refer to Note 13,
      <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Income
      Taxes</font>, in item 8 of this Form
10-K.</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr></table>

    <div>
      <div>
        <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr>
              <td valign="top" width="4%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: right">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">7.</font></div>
              </td>
              <td valign="top" width="80%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">For
      the year ended December 31, 2006, cash and cash equivalents did not
      include the normal CRJ-200 ASA end-of-month payment of $31.9 million,
      which was received on January 2, 2007 as December 31, 2006 fell on a
      non-business day.</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr><tr>
              <td valign="top" width="4%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: right">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">8.</font></div>
              </td>
              <td valign="top" width="80%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">As
      of December 31, 2007, property and equipment included the addition of
      three CRJ-900 aircraft.&#160;&#160;As of December 31, 2008, property and
      equipment include an additional 11 CRJ-900 aircraft and 15 Q400 aircraft
      that were received during 2008.</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr><tr>
              <td valign="top" width="4%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: right">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">9.</font></div>
              </td>
              <td valign="top" width="80%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Long-term
      debt obligations as of December 31, 2007 include financing for three
      CRJ-900 aircraft.&#160;&#160;Long-term debt obligations as of December 31,
      2008 include financing for 11 additional CRJ-900 aircraft and 15 Q400
      aircraft that were entered into during 2008.</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr><tr>
              <td valign="top" width="4%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: right">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">10.</font></div>
              </td>
              <td valign="top" width="80%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">For
      the year ended December 31, 2009, total assets include approximately $300
      million on long-term receivables related to potential claims related to
      Colgan Flight 3407. This amount is offset in its entirety by a
      corresponding liability.&#160;&#160;For more information, see Note 16,
      <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Commitments
      and Contingencies</font>, in Item 8 of this Form
  10-K.</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr></table>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">

</font></div>
      </div>

            <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="1%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
            <td valign="bottom" width="1%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
            <td valign="bottom" width="9%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">3,860</font></td>
            <td nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
            <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="1%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
            <td valign="bottom" width="1%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
            <td valign="bottom" width="7%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">3,436</font></td>
            <td nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
          </tr><tr bgcolor="#cceeff">
            <td colspan="20" valign="bottom" width="99%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
            <td nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
          </tr></table>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
    <div>
      <div>
        <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr>
              <td align="left" valign="top" width="4%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">11.</font></div>
              </td>
              <td valign="top" width="80%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 9pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">We
      acquired Colgan on January 18, 2007. Data for 2007 includes Colgan data
      and statistics from the date of acquisition through the end of the
      year.</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr><tr>
              <td align="left" valign="top" width="4%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">12.</font></div>
              </td>
              <td valign="top" width="80%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 9pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Statistical
      results for the year ended December 31, 2008 were affected by the addition
      throughout the year of regional jets operated under the CRJ-900 DCA and
      turboprops operated under the Continental CPA.&#160;&#160;As of December
      31, 2008, Pinnacle operated 18 CRJ-900 aircraft under the CRJ-900 DCA
      (seven of which were the Temporary Aircraft), and Colgan operated 15 Q400
      aircraft under the Continental CPA.</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr><tr>
              <td align="left" valign="top" width="4%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">13.</font></div>
              </td>
              <td valign="top" width="80%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 9pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Revenue
      passenger miles represent the number of miles flown by revenue
      passengers.</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr><tr>
              <td align="left" valign="top" width="4%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">14.</font></div>
              </td>
              <td valign="top" width="80%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 9pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Available
      seat miles represent the number of seats available for passengers
      multiplied by the number of miles the seats are flown.</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr><tr>
              <td align="left" valign="top" width="4%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">15.</font></div>
              </td>
              <td valign="top" width="80%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 9pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Passenger
      load factor equals revenue passenger miles divided by available seat
      miles.</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr></table><br></div>
    </div>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
      </div>

          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
        </div>

      </div>
    </div><br>

6.&#160;&#160;Selected Financial Data</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Certain
Statistical Information:</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 52pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
following tables present our operating expenses per block hour and operating
expenses per available seat mile.&#160;&#160;While not relevant to our financial
results, this data is used as an analytic in the airline
industry.&#160;&#160;Please see <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Results of Operations</font> in Item
7 of this Form 10-K for more information on our operating expenses.</font></div>

            <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="40%">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; TEXT-INDENT: -27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Provision
      for (decreases) increases in losses associated with bankruptcy filings of
      Northwest and Mesaba</font></div>
            </td>

            <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="40%">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Other</font></div>
            </td>
            <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="1%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>

    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div><br>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">29</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><a name="Item7MDA">Item 7.&#160;&#160;Management&#8217;s Discussion and Analysis of
Financial Condition and Results of
Operations</a></font></div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div><br>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><a name="Item7OverviewAndOutlook">Overview and Outlook</a></font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Our
results of operations improved substantially in 2009 as compared to
2008.&#160;&#160;Our consolidated operating income improved by $35.1 million in
2009 as compared to 2008.&#160;&#160;As more fully discussed below under
&#8220;Results of Operations,&#8221; these improvements came about through, among other
things, the full implementation of our new capacity purchase agreements with
Delta and Continental, a significant decrease in the cost of fuel incurred by
Colgan&#8217;s pro-rate operations, and the restructuring of Colgan&#8217;s pro-rate
operations.&#160;&#160;Partially offsetting these improvements was a decline in
unit revenue in Colgan&#8217;s pro-rate operations, and increased labor and
maintenance costs throughout our operations.&#160;&#160;Our net income in 2009
is also substantially increased as a result of our settlement with the Internal
Revenue Service related to their review of our tax filings for 2003, 2004, and
2005.&#160;&#160;We recorded a nonrecurring increase in net income of $15.4
million from this settlement.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In
addition to improvements in our operating and net income, we completed a number
of transactions during 2009 to increase our liquidity in advance of the date
that holders of our remaining outstanding 3.25% senior convertible notes (the
&#8220;Notes&#8221;) could require us to repurchase them.&#160;&#160;Holders of the Notes
had an option on February 15, 2010 (the &#8220;Put Date&#8221;) to require us to repurchase
the then outstanding Notes for the par amount plus accrued
interest.&#160;&#160;Because of this impending obligation in February 2010,
during 2009 we focused on increasing our liquidity and reducing the amount of
the Notes outstanding through secondary market repurchases.&#160;&#160;During
the third quarter of 2009, we completed a $25 million term loan collateralized
by our spare rotable and expendable aircraft parts inventory and certain spare
engines (the &#8220;Spare Parts Loan&#8221;).&#160;&#160;In addition, we entered into a
settlement agreement (the &#8220;ARS Settlement&#8221;) with the financial institution that
sold us our portfolio of auction rate securities (&#8220;ARS&#8221;).&#160;&#160;The ARS
Settlement increased our cash balance by approximately $27 million. As a result
of these transactions and positive operating cash flow of $105.6 million during
2009, we substantially increased our liquidity position.&#160;&#160;We used this
increase in liquidity to repurchase $12 million par amount of the Notes in the
first quarter of 2009 and approximately $78 million par amount of the Notes
during the third quarter of 2009.&#160;&#160;Approximately $31 million par
amount of the Notes remained outstanding as of December 31, 2009.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In
addition, we received a federal income tax refund in late February 2010 totaling
approximately $38 million related to our 2009 federal income tax
return.&#160;&#160;Receipt of this refund further enhanced our liquidity
position.&#160;&#160;In January 2010, we completed a $10 million short-term
credit facility collateralized by our federal income tax
receivable.&#160;&#160;This facility was designed to increase our working
capital until we received our 2009 tax refund.&#160;&#160;We repaid the facility
in late February upon receipt of our tax refund.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Finally,
in January 2010, we modified a financial covenant to maintain a certain level of
unrestricted cash and cash equivalents contained in our Spare Parts Loan to
lower the minimum requirement to $22.5 million for the first quarter of 2010
(for additional information regarding this minimum cash requirement test, please
refer to Note 7 of our consolidated financial statements, which are contained in
Item 8 of this Form 10-K).&#160;&#160;As a result of these accomplishments, we
had sufficient resources to repay the remaining outstanding $31.0 million par
amount of Notes on the Put Date and meet our minimum cash requirement
test.&#160;&#160;As of February 16, 2010, and after repurchase of the Notes, we
had consolidated unrestricted cash and cash equivalents of approximately $60
million, and we believe our liquidity will be adequate to fund our operations
and meet our financial covenants for the foreseeable future.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">There are
several open disputed contractual issues, primarily related to our CRJ-200 ASA,
between Delta and us.&#160;&#160;Some of these issues date back to 2007, and we
have been in discussions with Delta since that time in an attempt to reach
resolution.&#160;&#160;The current status of each issue is discussed in greater
detail below.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">First,
Delta has challenged a one-time adjustment to our block hour, cycle and fixed
payment rates under our CRJ-200 ASA that was to become effective January 1,
2006.&#160;&#160;Niether party&#160;has ever&#160;applied a rate increase or
rate decrease related to this provision under the CRJ-200 ASA, and we have
received payments from Delta since 2006 as if there were no adjustment under
this provision of the CRJ-200 ASA.&#160;&#160;Based on the objection notice we
received from Delta in 2007, the impact of Delta&#8217;s assertion could be a
cumulative adjustment of as much as $11.0 million for 2006 through 2009, and a
rate decrease of approximately $3.0 million annually until the next
contractually scheduled rate adjustment on January 1, 2013.&#160;&#160;We
believe the rate adjustment, were it applicable, would result in an increase in
our rates.&#160;&#160;The parties have agreed to arbitrate this dispute if we
are unable to successfully resolve this matter through further
negotiation.</font></div><br>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">30</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Item
7.&#160;&#160;Management&#8217;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and
Results of Operations</font></div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div><br>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Overview
and Outlook (Continued)</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Second,
during 2009, Delta also disputed its obligation to fully reimburse us for
aviation insurance premiums related to our Delta Connection operations.&#160;
During the second quarter of 2009, Delta requested that we exit the Delta
aviation insurance program and independently source our own aviation
insurance.&#160; Effective July 1, 2009, we obtained our own independent
insurance program at a cost significantly higher than what we were allocated by
Delta under the Delta insurance program.&#160; Delta has asserted that it is not
obligated to reimburse the full costs of aviation insurance obtained under our
independent insurance program related to our Delta Connection
operations.&#160;&#160;Since July, Delta has failed to reimburse us for $3.4
million of aviation insurance premiums related to our Delta Connection
operations.&#160;&#160;During the fourth quarter of 2009, we concluded that we
did not meet the accounting standards to recognize future unreimbursed insurance
premiums as revenue until we reach conclusion of this matter with Delta, and we
did not recognize $1.7 million of unreimbursed insurance costs.&#160;&#160;We
firmly believe that our operating agreements with Delta require full
reimbursement of our actual aviation insurance premiums related to Delta
Connection operations, and we are evaluating our potential remedies related to
this dispute.&#160; We continue to discuss this matter with Delta, and we
believe that the parties will resolve this issue in the near
future.&#160;&#160;To the extent that we are unable to successfully resolve this
matter through discussion, we may be forced to take legal action to protect our
contractual rights under our agreements with Delta.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Additionally,
during 2009 Delta asserted that it may materially alter the payments related to
the ground handling of our flights in the majority of the airports where we
operate under our CRJ-200 ASA, resulting in a decrease in our annual operating
income of approximately $1.1 million (subject to fluctuation based on changes in
the level of our operations and the cities where we fly under the CRJ-200
ASA).&#160; In August 2009, Delta began to apply its&#160;interpretation of
ground handling to the monthly payments that Pinnacle received, resulting in a
net reduction of payments to Pinnacle of approximately $0.4 million for August
through December 2009.&#160; In addition, Delta asserted that Pinnacle owed
Delta a retroactive payment related to this ground handling issue of
approximately $4 million. &#160;In early 2010, in connection with the tentative
settlement of several items, we tentatively agreed to accept Delta&#8217;s treatment
of ground handling costs without any retroactive application prior to August 1,
2009.&#160;&#160;We expect this change to reduce our operating income by
approximately $1.1 million in 2010.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In
connection with the resolution of our ground handling dispute, we also
tentatively agreed to stipulate the amount owed to Delta under a provision of
the CRJ-200 ASA associated with the sharing of Pinnacle&#8217;s overhead upon the
establishment of a certain level of operations outside of the CRJ-200
ASA.&#160;&#160;Under our tentative agreement, Delta will receive a rate
reduction of $2.0 million for 2010 and $2.5 million for 2011, and $2.5 million
for 2012 to satisfy this provision.&#160;&#160;The parties also tentatively
settled an outstanding dispute related to the change in aircraft livery of
Pinnacle&#8217;s CRJ-200 fleet by Delta agreeing to reimburse us for these
costs.&#160;&#160;Finally, as part of the tentative agreement, Delta agreed to
modify the payment terms of some of our airport related costs under certain
circumstances, which will provide us some limited protection in the event that
Delta asks us to operate in different markets in the future.&#160;&#160;These
matters, as well as resolution of our ground handling issue noted above, are
subject to the execution of a binding written agreement, which the parties are
in the process of preparing; however, no assurances can be given that additional
modification to these and other arrangements will not occur in order to settle
these matters with Delta.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Our
pro-rate operations, which account for approximately 18% of our consolidated
revenue, are susceptible to changes in passenger demand and fuel price
volatility.&#160;&#160;We took a number of steps during late 2008 and early 2009
to eliminate unprofitable markets, reduce costs, and increase revenue in our
remaining pro-rate markets.&#160;&#160;These steps and lower fuel prices have
returned our pro-rate operations to profitability during
2009.&#160;&#160;However, the airline industry is experiencing the effects of
the current recessionary environment in the United States.&#160;&#160;Industry
passenger revenue declined dramatically during 2009, and our pro-rate operations
were negatively affected by this drop.&#160;&#160;While industry analysts
forecast a recovery in passenger demand during 2010, we cannot predict whether
there will be an increase in fares associated with our pro-rate operations in
2010.&#160;&#160;&#160;In addition, in connection with the US Airways
announcement of proposed reductions in service at LaGuardia, we discontinued our
pro-rate operations at LaGuardia in early January 2010, reducing our operations
under our US Airways agreement by four aircraft.&#160;&#160;We are currently
evaluating other markets and may enter new markets later in 2010.&#160;&#160;If
we do not identify profitable replacement markets for these aircraft, then our
pro-rate revenue and profitability in 2010 will be materially affected by this
reduction. Further, our pro-rate operations are still susceptible to seasonal
demand fluctuations, with passenger demand materially weaker during the fourth
and first quarter of each year as compared to the seasonally high demand we
typically experience in the second and third quarters of each
year.&#160;&#160;Similar to prior years, we do not expect to earn a significant
amount of operating income from our pro-rate operations during the first quarter
of 2010.</font></div><br>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">31</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Item
7.&#160;&#160;Management&#8217;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and
Results of Operations</font></div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div><br>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Overview
and Outlook (Continued)</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">During
the fourth quarter of 2009, we relocated Colgan&#8217;s headquarters from Manassas,
Virginia to Memphis, Tennessee.&#160;&#160;We believe that relocating Colgan&#8217;s
leadership team and system operations control center to our corporate
headquarters will enhance the financial and operational performance of Colgan
long-term due to a lower cost of living and the sharing of operational and
safety &#8220;best practices&#8221; between Pinnacle and Colgan.&#160;&#160;In addition, we
are negotiating with state and local authorities to obtain certain long-term
incentives that will help offset the cost of relocating Colgan&#8217;s
headquarters.&#160;&#160;We incurred approximately $1.1 million of costs
associated with this move during 2009, and expect to incur additional costs of
approximately $0.1 million during the first quarter of 2010.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Pinnacle
has been involved in negotiations with the Air Line Pilots Association (&#8220;ALPA&#8221;)
since April 2005, when the collective bargaining agreement between the two
parties became amendable.&#160;&#160;On August 4, 2009, Pinnacle and ALPA
reached a tentative agreement to amend the collective bargaining
agreement.&#160;&#160;However, Pinnacle&#8217;s pilots did not ratify the tentative
agreement.&#160;&#160;The National Mediation Board now controls the timing of
further negotiations with ALPA, and we do not yet have information as to when
further negotiations will take place.&#160;&#160;The failed tentative agreement
provided for an increase in compensation for Pinnacle&#8217;s pilots to the industry
average, which is consistent with our company-wide philosophy of
industry-average pay and benefits.&#160;&#160;In addition, the failed tentative
agreement called for a one-time signing bonus of approximately $10.2
million.&#160;&#160;While we cannot predict what the terms of a new tentative
agreement will contain, we do expect any new tentative agreement to
substantially increase Pinnacle&#8217;s salaries, wages and benefits
costs.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Colgan&#8217;s
pilots also elected representation by ALPA in late 2008, and we recently began
negotiations with ALPA.&#160;&#160;It is too early in the negotiation process
for us to predict the timing or impact of a new collective bargaining agreement
with ALPA covering Colgan&#8217;s pilots.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Throughout
2009 we have been positioning ourselves for additional profitable growth
opportunities in 2010 and beyond.&#160;&#160;In early 2009 we agreed with
Continental to expand our Continental CPA by acquiring 15 Q400 aircraft from
August 2010 through April 2011.&#160;&#160;We also acquired an additional 15
Q400 options from the aircraft manufacturer, thereby increasing the total
remaining number of our Q400 options to 30.&#160;&#160;These options, if
exercised, provide for the delivery of 15 Q400s in 2011 and the remaining 15 in
2013.&#160;&#160;The Q400 aircraft has become a very competitive product within
the regional airline industry.&#160;&#160;The purchase price of the Q400 is
significantly less than that of comparably sized regional jets, and the Q400
uses up to 30% less fuel.&#160;&#160;As a result, we can offer our airline
partners a large, passenger-friendly regional aircraft with a lower operating
cost than that of similarly sized&#160;regional jets.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In
addition to growing Colgan with the Q400 aircraft, we are positioning ourselves
to capitalize on long-term opportunities to increase the number of regional jets
that we operate at Pinnacle.&#160;&#160;Capacity purchase agreements for over
400 50-seat regional jet aircraft at our competitors are set to expire between
now and 2015.&#160;&#160;While many of these regional jets will likely no longer
operate within the networks of the major U.S. airlines, we believe some of these
contracts will be renewed or offered to other regional airlines and some will be
replaced with larger regional jets.&#160;&#160;We intend to actively compete to
obtain profitable regional jet flying during this period of transition within
the industry, and we believe our history of strong operating performance with a
competitive cost structure will position us to succeed.&#160;&#160;Our capacity
purchase contracts do not begin to expire until December 2017.</font></div><br>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">32</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Item
7.&#160;&#160;Management&#8217;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and
Results of Operations</font></div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div><br>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><a name="Item7ResultsOfOperations">Results of Operations</a></font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>The following represents our results of
operations, by segment and consolidated, for the year ended December 31,
2009.&#160;&#160;A discussion of our results of operations as compared to the
same periods in 2008 and 2007 follows.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div align="center">
      <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="95%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">

            </td>

      airline services</font></div>

            <td nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
            <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="1%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
            <td valign="bottom" width="1%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">$</font></td>
            <td valign="bottom" width="15%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">836,249</font></td>

            <td nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px; TEXT-ALIGN: left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>

    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
following discussion provides an analysis of our results of operations and
reasons for material changes therein for the year ended December 31, 2009
compared to the same periods in 2008 and 2007.&#160;&#160;The acquisition of
Colgan was completed on January 18, 2007 and Colgan&#8217;s 2007 data includes the
period from the acquisition date through December 31, 2007, which represents
approximately 94% of that year.</font></div><br>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
      </div>

        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
        </div>
      </div>

Compared to 2008</font></div>

    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
following summarizes the nonrecurring items affecting our results for the years
ended December 31, 2009 and 2008 (in thousands):</font></div>

            </td>
            <td nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px; TEXT-ALIGN: left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
