            <td align="left" valign="bottom">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Operating
      margin</font></div>
            </td>
            <td align="right" valign="bottom"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
            <td valign="bottom" style="TEXT-ALIGN: left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
            <td valign="bottom" style="TEXT-ALIGN: right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">9.1</font></td>
            <td nowrap valign="bottom" style="TEXT-ALIGN: left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">%</font></td>
            <td align="right" valign="bottom"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
            <td align="right" colspan="2" valign="bottom">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">12.3
      pts.</font></div>
            </td>
            <td nowrap valign="bottom" style="TEXT-ALIGN: left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
            <td align="right" valign="bottom"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
            <td valign="bottom" style="TEXT-ALIGN: left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
            <td valign="bottom" style="TEXT-ALIGN: right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">(3.2</font></td>
            <td nowrap valign="bottom" style="TEXT-ALIGN: left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">)%</font></td>
            <td align="right" valign="bottom"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
            <td align="right" colspan="2" valign="bottom">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">(0.6)
      pts.</font></div>
            </td>
            <td nowrap valign="bottom" style="TEXT-ALIGN: left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
            <td align="right" valign="bottom"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
            <td valign="bottom" style="TEXT-ALIGN: left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
            <td valign="bottom" style="TEXT-ALIGN: right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">(2.6</font></td>
            <td nowrap valign="bottom" style="TEXT-ALIGN: left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">)%</font></td>
          </tr></table>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Salaries,
wages and benefits increased by $1.8 million, or 3%, for the year ended December
31, 2009 as compared to 2008.&#160;&#160;This increase is largely attributable
to increased health care and insurance costs, which increased by approximately
$0.5 million in 2009, as compared to 2008.&#160;&#160;Additionally, a number of
relocated Colgan employees received additional compensation as part of the
Colgan headquarters relocation from Manassas, Virginia to
Memphis.&#160;&#160;The remaining increase relates to an increase in wage rates
for existing employees.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Aircraft
rentals decreased by $3.6 million, or 48%, for the year ended December 31,
2009.&#160;&#160;This decrease is attributable to the return of eight leased
Saab and Beech aircraft.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Ground
handling services decreased by $1.0 million, or 8%, for the year ended December
31, 2009, as compared to 2008.&#160;&#160;This was primarily attributable to the
decrease in departures in our pro-rate operations.&#160;&#160;The increase in
our Q400 operations had no effect on ground handling services expense, as ground
handling services associated with our Q400 operations are provided by
Continental at no cost under the Continental CPA.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Aircraft
maintenance, materials and repairs expenses decreased by $5.7 million, or 13%,
for the year ended December 31, 2009 as compared to 2008.&#160;&#160;This
decrease is related to the removal of seven Saab and Beech aircraft from our
pro-rate fleet.&#160;&#160;These aircraft were out of warranty and required more
maintenance expense than our new fleet of Q400 aircraft, which are currently
covered under warranty.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Other
rentals and landing fees increased by $2.1 million, or 11%, as compared to the
same period in 2008.&#160;&#160;Landing fees associated with our pro-rate
operations decreased by $5.2 million related to the overall decrease in our
pro-rate operations.&#160;&#160;Landing fees associated with the Continental CPA
increased by $7.1 million as a result of changes in Q400 fleet size, along with
the fact that we are now serving markets with significantly higher landing fee
rates, such as Newark/Liberty International Airport.&#160;&#160;Landing fees
associated with our Continental CPA are fully reimbursed by
Continental.&#160;&#160;Most airports in our network have also increased their
rates as a result of an overall reduction in industry-wide
capacity.</font></div><br>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">44</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Item
7.&#160;&#160;Management&#8217;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and
Results of Operations</font></div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div><br>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Consolidated and Segmented
Results of Operations (Continued)</font></font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Aircraft
fuel expense decreased by $27.3 million, or 55%, for the year ended December 31,
2009 as compared to 2008.&#160;&#160;This decline is primarily related to the
decrease in the average price of fuel.&#160;&#160;Colgan&#8217;s average price paid
per gallon decreased 40% during the year ended December 31, 2009, as compared to
2008.&#160;&#160;In addition, gallons consumed decreased by 26% for the year
ended December 31, 2009, due to the retirement of several of our Saab and Beech
aircraft in conjunction with the elimination of certain markets operated under
pro-rate agreements.&#160;&#160;Aircraft fuel associated with our Q400
operations is provided at no cost under the Continental CPA.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Commissions
and passenger related expenses decreased by $3.8 million, or 18%, for the year
ended December 31, 2009 as compared to 2008.&#160;&#160;This is primarily
attributable to the 15% decrease in passengers carried by our pro-rate
operations.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Depreciation
and amortization expense increased by $2.0 million, or 15%, for the year ended
December 31, 2009, as compared to the same period in 2008.&#160;&#160;This is
primarily related to changes in the Q400 aircraft fleet size.&#160;&#160;The
Q400 aircraft were added to our fleet throughout 2008.&#160;&#160;However,
during the year ended December 31, 2009, we operated one fewer aircraft than the
same period in the previous year.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Other
expenses decreased by $5.6 million, or 23%, for the year ended December 31,
2009, as compared to the same period in 2008.&#160; This decrease is primarily
related to decreases in costs related to crew training and other crew related
expenses.&#160;&#160;This was related to low levels of flight crew attrition,
which reduced levels of training as experienced flight crews are
retained.&#160;&#160;In contrast, we incurred significant training costs during
the first half of 2008 as we were introducing the Q400 fleet.&#160;&#160;As a
result, flight crew related costs decreased by $5.0 million for the year ended
December 31, 2009.&#160;&#160;The remaining decrease is attributable to the
fleet expansion expenses we incurred in 2008 as we were bringing the Q400
operations online.&#160;&#160;Offsetting these decreases is an increase in
insurance expense of $1.1 million.&#160;&#160;As previously discussed, effective
July 1, 2009, we obtained new insurance coverage with significantly higher
rates.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Impairment
and aircraft retirement charges of $2.0 million for the year ended December 31,
2009 related to certain maintenance costs necessary to restore certain Saab and
Beech aircraft to a condition suitable for return to the lessor or for
sale.&#160;&#160;In the year ended December 31, 2008, impairment and aircraft
retirement charges of $13.6 million primarily related to the impairment of
Colgan&#8217;s goodwill.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 1.4pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">2008
Compared to 2007</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -1pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Salaries,
wages and benefits increased by $9.6 million, or 21%, during the year ended
December 31, 2008.&#160;&#160;Excluding the effect of the previously discussed
difference in time periods presented, this expense increased primarily due to
the increase in the average number of employees of 10%, largely attributed to
the growth of Colgan&#8217;s operating fleet related to its new Q400 operation, as
well as wage rate and benefit increases for existing employees.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Aircraft
rentals decreased by $0.9 million, or 10%, for the year ended December 31,
2008.&#160;&#160;This decrease is attributable to the return of 11 of our Saab
and Beech aircraft during 2008.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Ground
handling services increased $0.9 million, or 8%, during the year ended December
31, 2008 as compared to 2007.&#160;&#160;This was primarily attributable to the
shift of several markets from our US Airways operations to our United
operations.&#160;&#160;Ground handling rates for United are significantly higher
than those previously charged by US Airways.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Aircraft
maintenance, materials and repairs expense increased by $3.5 million, or 9%, for
the year ended December 31, 2008.&#160;&#160;Colgan incurred an additional $2.0
million in heavy airframe maintenance during 2008.&#160;&#160;Due to internal
resource constraints, Colgan utilized third-party vendors for heavy airframe
maintenance during 2008.&#160;&#160;During 2007, most aircraft heavy maintenance
checks were performed by Colgan in-house.&#160;&#160;The remaining $1.5 million
additional increase is attributable to the aging of our Saab fleet and addition
of our Q400 operations.</font></div><br>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">45</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Item
7.&#160;&#160;Management&#8217;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and
Results of Operations</font></div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div><br>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Consolidated and Segmented
Results of Operations (Continued)</font></font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Other
rentals and landing fees increased $8.5 million, or 85%, for the year ended
December 31, 2008.&#160;&#160;Landing fees increased as a result of increased
departures and operating the larger Q400 aircraft, which fly into markets with
significantly higher landing fee rates, such as Newark/Liberty International
Airport.&#160;&#160;Landing fees associated with our Q400 operations are
reimbursed directly by Continental; therefore, an offsetting amount is included
in revenue.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Aircraft
fuel expense increased $11.3 million, or 30%, for the year ended December 31,
2008.&#160;&#160;This increase is primarily related to the 48% year-over-year
increase in the average price per gallon of fuel.&#160;&#160;Offsetting this
increase in fuel price was a 12% decrease in gallons consumed for the year ended
December 31, 2008 as a result of a 9% decrease in our pro-rate block hours due
to the retirement of 11 of our Saab and Beech aircraft.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Depreciation
and amortization expense increased by $8.5 million for the year ended December
31, 2008.&#160;&#160;This is primarily related to $7.2 million of depreciation
expense related to the new Q400 aircraft.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Other
expenses increased by $6.5 million, or 37%, during the year ended December 31,
2008, as compared to 2007.&#160; This increase primarily relates to increased
crew travel expense primarily due to our new Continental Q400
operations.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Impairment
of goodwill and aircraft retirement costs increased by $13.5
million.&#160;&#160;During 2008, we recorded a $10.5 million impairment charge
related to Colgan&#8217;s goodwill and certain intangible assets.&#160;&#160;In
addition, we recorded $3.0 million for aircraft retirement costs related to
several of our Saab and Beech aircraft.&#160;&#160;For more information, refer
to Note 14, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Impairment of
Goodwill and Aircraft Retirement Costs, </font>in Item 8 of this Form
10-K.</font></div><br>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">46</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Item
7.&#160;&#160;Management&#8217;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and
Results of Operations</font></div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><a name="Item7Liquidity">Liquidity and Capital Resources</a></font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">We
generate cash primarily by providing regional airline and related services to
our code-share partners and passengers.&#160;&#160;As of December 31, 2009, we
had cash and cash equivalents of $91.6 million.&#160;&#160;Net cash provided by
operations was $105.6 million for the year ended December 31,
2009.&#160;&#160;This included a 2008 federal income tax refund of approximately
$33 million that we received on April 1, 2009. We do not anticipate making
federal income tax payments in 2010 due to the accelerated depreciation
recognized for tax purposes related to our newly acquired CRJ-900 and Q400
aircraft, and we received a federal tax refund of approximately $38 million in
late February 2010 related to the 2009 tax year.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Contractual obligations</font>. The
following chart details our debt and lease obligations at December 31, 2009 (in
thousands):</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

    <div>
      <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr>
            <td valign="top" width="3%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: right">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt; TEXT-ALIGN: right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">(1)</font></div>
            </td>
            <td valign="top" width="67%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">During
      2009, we repurchased $90,021 par amount of our $121,000 3.25% senior
      convertible notes due 2025.&#160;&#160;The remaining Notes were
      repurchased in February 2010.&#160; As of February 16, 2010, no par amount
      of Notes remain outstanding.</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td valign="top" width="3%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: right">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt; TEXT-ALIGN: right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">(2)</font></div>
            </td>
            <td valign="top" width="67%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">The
      amounts noted above for operating leases include $904,704 of obligations
      for CRJ-200 aircraft leased from Delta.&#160;&#160;We are reimbursed by
      Delta in full for CRJ-200 aircraft rental expense under the CRJ-200
      ASA.&#160;&#160;For a more detailed discussion of operating leases, refer
      to Note 9 in Item 8 of this Form 10-K.</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td valign="top" width="3%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: right">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt; TEXT-ALIGN: right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">(3)</font></div>
            </td>
            <td valign="top" width="67%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">The
      table above excludes an approximate $300 million accident liability
      related to Flight 3407, recorded in other liabilities, as discussed
      in&#160;&#160;Note 16, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Commitments
      and Contingencies</font>, in Item 8 of this Form 10-K.&#160;&#160;This
      liability is offset in its entirety by a receivable, recorded in other
      assets, which the Company expects to receive from insurance carriers as
      claims are resolved.</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr></table>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">On
January 13, 2010, we entered into a short-term loan agreement with a bank for
$10.0 million (the &#8220;Bridge Loan&#8221;).&#160;&#160;The Bridge Loan was secured by our
2009 federal income tax refund and had an effective interest rate of 4.5%, and
matures on April 1, 2010.&#160;&#160;The Bridge Loan was designed to temporarily
provide us with additional working capital until we received our 2009 federal
income tax refund.&#160;&#160;We repaid the Bridge Loan in full upon receipt of
our 2009 federal income tax refund in late February 2010.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In August
2009, we entered into a Purchase and Release Agreement (the &#8220;ARS Settlement
Agreement&#8221;) with the financial institution that originally sold us the ARS
portfolio.&#160;&#160;Pursuant to the terms of the ARS Settlement Agreement, the
institution purchased our ARS portfolio at a discount to par plus accrued
interest.&#160;&#160;In addition, the institution granted us three-year options
to repurchase all or a portion of the ARS from the institution at the same
discount to par that the institution paid to us under the ARS Settlement
Agreement (the &#8220;ARS Call Options&#8221;).&#160;&#160;We used the majority of the
proceeds to repay a margin loan facility that the institution had previously
provided to us in response to the failure of the ARS market (the &#8220;Credit
Facility&#8221;).&#160;&#160;After repayment of the Credit Facility, we received
approximately $27 million from the ARS Settlement.&#160;&#160;Our ARS Call
Options were valued at $2.7 million at December 31, 2009.</font></div><br>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">47</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">

      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Item
7.&#160;&#160;Management&#8217;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and
Results of Operations</font></div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div><br>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Liquidity
and Capital Resources (Continued)</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>In July 2009, we completed a three-year
term loan financing for $25 million (the &#8220;Spare Parts Loan&#8221;).&#160;&#160;The
Spare Parts Loan is secured by our pool of spare repairable, rotable and
expendable parts and certain aircraft engines.&#160;&#160;The interest rate for
the Spare Parts Loan is a variable rate, which is indexed to LIBOR (subject to a
floor) and was 8.5% as of December 31, 2009. The Spare Parts Loan requires that
we maintain a minimum liquidity level at the end of every month and at specified
times preceding the maturity date or call date of certain other indebtedness.
The Spare Parts Loan also has standard provisions relating to our obligation to
timely repay the indebtedness and maintenance of the collateral base relative to
the outstanding principal amount of the borrowing.&#160;&#160;On January 13,
2010, we amended the Spare Parts Loan to reduce the required minimum liquidity
level on four specific dates during the first quarter of
2010.&#160;&#160;Amounts outstanding under the Spare Parts Loan were $24.2
million as of December 31, 2009.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In
February 2005, we issued $121.0 million principal amount of our 3.25% senior
convertible notes due 2025.&#160; The Notes bear interest at the rate of 3.25%
per year, payable in cash semiannually in arrears on February 15 and August 15
of each year.&#160; The Notes are convertible into a combination of cash and
common stock at a conversion price of approximately $13.22.&#160; The Notes are
convertible in any quarter subsequent to a quarter in which the closing price of
our common stock exceeds $15.86 for 20 of the last 30 trading days.&#160; This
condition was not met during the year ended December 31, 2009, and consequently
the Notes were not convertible by the holders during 2009 or the first quarter
of 2010 while they were still outstanding.&#160; On February 15, 2010, the
holders of the Notes exercised their option to require us to purchase all of the
remaining outstanding Notes for cash at a purchase price equal to 100% of their
principal amount plus accrued interest.&#160; As a result, the entire remaining
carrying amount of the Notes is classified as a current liability on our
consolidated balance sheet as of December 31, 2009.&#160; On February 16, 2010,
we repurchased the remaining outstanding Notes.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In
February 2007, we entered into a purchase agreement for up to 25 firm and 20
option Q400 aircraft with Bombardier, Inc.&#160;&#160;Under the agreement, we
were obligated to purchase a minimum of 15 Q400 regional aircraft, which we
satisfied during 2008.&#160;&#160;In January 2009, we modified the purchase
agreement to exercise our right to purchase the remaining ten firm Q400 aircraft
and five of the option Q400 aircraft, which will be delivered between August
2010 and April 2011.&#160;&#160;We also secured additional options to acquire 15
Q400 aircraft that would be delivered in 2013.&#160;&#160;Upon completion of
this amendment, we now have optional rights to acquire a total of 30 Q400
aircraft, 15 of which would deliver in 2011 and 15 of which would deliver in
2013.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In April
2007, Delta assigned to us its rights to purchase 16 CRJ-900 aircraft from
Bombardier, Inc.&#160;&#160;As of December 31, 2009, we had accepted delivery of
all 16 of these aircraft.&#160;&#160;Under the CRJ-900 DCA, Delta has the right
to require us to purchase and operate an additional seven CRJ-900
aircraft.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">We are
required to make pre-delivery payments to Bombardier for the 15 firm Q400
aircraft that we have on order.&#160;&#160;These payments began in January 2009
and will continue through October 2010.&#160;&#160;Approximately 85% of the
remaining pre-delivery payments to be made in 2010 will be financed under a
pre-delivery payment financing facility provided by Export Development Canada
(&#8220;EDC&#8221;).&#160;&#160;The remaining 15% or approximately $5 million will be funded
through our internal capital resources.&#160;&#160;This unfinanced portion of
our pre-delivery payment requirements is scheduled to be paid in the second
quarter of 2010.&#160;&#160;The interest rate associated with this pre-delivery
payment facility is indexed to LIBOR, and was 3.43% as of December 31,
2009.&#160;&#160;The outstanding balance of these borrowings as of December 31,
2009 was $6.9 million.&#160;&#160;As each aircraft is delivered to us, we repay
the associated borrowings.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Upon
delivery of our CRJ-900 and Q400 aircraft, we obtained long-term financing,
ranging from 10 to 15 years, for 85% of the aircraft purchase price, the balance
of which was $513.5 million at December 31, 2009.&#160;&#160;We have also
obtained a commitment from EDC to finance 85% of the purchase price of the 15
Q400 aircraft on order upon the delivery of each aircraft.</font></div><br>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
