              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">2%</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr><tr bgcolor="white">
            <td valign="top" width="17%">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Total</font></div>
            </td>
            <td valign="top" width="2%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;
      </font></td>
            <td valign="bottom" width="16%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">82%</font></div>
            </td>
            <td valign="top" width="2%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;
      </font></td>
            <td valign="top" width="12%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">4%</font></div>
            </td>
            <td valign="top" width="2%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;
      </font></td>
            <td valign="top" width="12%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">14%</font></div>
            </td>
            <td valign="top" width="2%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;
      </font></td>
            <td valign="top" width="13%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">100%</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr></table>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Capacity
Purchase Agreements</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
Company&#8217;s preferred contractual relationships with major airlines are structured
as capacity purchase agreements (&#8220;CPAs&#8221;).&#160;&#160;Under CPAs, major airline
partners purchase the Company&#8217;s flying capacity by paying pre-determined rates
for specified flying, regardless of the number of passengers on board or the
amount of revenue collected from passengers.&#160;&#160;These arrangements
typically include incentive payments when the Company meets certain operational
performance measures.&#160;&#160;Additionally, certain operating costs such as
fuel, aircraft rent or ownership costs, aviation insurance premiums, certain
ground handling and airport related costs, and property taxes are reimbursed or
paid for directly by the partner, which eliminates the Company&#8217;s risk associated
with a change in the price of these goods or services.&#160; The Company earns
additional revenue for costs reimbursed by the partner due to the contractual
margin or mark-up payments added to the reimbursed cost when the Company
invoices its partner for reimbursement.&#160;&#160;Conversely, while the Company
bears no risk for the change in the prices of costs paid directly by the
partner, the Company also earns no additional revenue related to the contractual
margin added to reimbursed costs.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
Company currently operates under the following CPAs:</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">CRJ-200 ASA</font>.&#160;&#160;The
Company, through its Pinnacle subsidiary, provides regional jet service to Delta
under an amended and restated airline services agreement (the &#8220;CRJ-200 ASA&#8221;)
that became effective as of January 1, 2007 and expires in December
2017.&#160;&#160;At the end of its term in 2017, the CRJ-200 ASA automatically
extends for additional five-year periods unless Delta provides notice to the
Company two years prior to the termination date that it does not plan to extend
the term.&#160;&#160;The Company subleases its 126 CRJ-200 aircraft from Delta,
and Delta reimburses the Company&#8217;s CRJ-200 aircraft rental expense in full under
the terms of the CRJ-200 ASA.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">CRJ-900 DCA</font>.&#160;&#160;On
April 27, 2007, the Company entered into a ten-year CPA with Delta under which
Pinnacle operates 16 CRJ-900 aircraft, each for ten years, as a Delta Connection
Carrier (the &#8220;CRJ-900 DCA&#8221;).&#160;&#160;Delta also has the option to add an
additional seven CRJ-900 aircraft under the CRJ-900 DCA.&#160;&#160;As of
December 31, 2009, Pinnacle operated 16 CRJ-900 aircraft under the CRJ-900
DCA.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Continental
CPA</font>.&#160;&#160;On February 5, 2007, the Company entered into a CPA (the
&#8220;Continental CPA&#8221;), with Continental under which Colgan operates Q400 regional
aircraft predominantly out of Continental&#8217;s hub at Newark/Liberty International
Airport.&#160;&#160;As of December 31, 2009 Colgan operated 14 Q400 aircraft,
most of which were delivered and placed in service in the first half of
2008.&#160;&#160;Each aircraft will be operated under the Continental CPA for a
term of ten years from the date it was placed into service.&#160;&#160;On
January 13, 2009, the Company amended the Continental CPA to operate an
additional 15 Q400 aircraft. The additional aircraft, which are scheduled to
deliver on various dates between August 2010 and April 2011, will be placed into
service for Continental beginning in September 2010.</font></div><br>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">70</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Pinnacle
Airlines Corp.</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Notes
to Consolidated Financial Statements</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(All
amounts in thousands, except per share data)</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div><br>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">3.&#160;&#160;Code-share
Agreements with Partners (Continued)</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Under its
CPAs, the Company receives the following payments from the major
airline:</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -1pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Reimbursement
payments</font>:&#160;&#160;The Company receives monthly reimbursements for
certain expenses associated with CPA operations.&#160;&#160;These vary by
contract, but might include: basic aircraft and engine rentals; aviation
liability, war risk and hull insurance; third-party deicing services;
third-party engine and airframe maintenance; hub and maintenance facility
rentals; passenger security costs; certain ground handling expenses; certain
landing fees and property taxes.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -1pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
Company has no direct financial risk associated with cost fluctuations for these
items because the Company is reimbursed by the major airline for the actual
expenses incurred.&#160;&#160;The CPAs provide that the major airline partner
will supply certain supplies and services such as fuel and aircraft rent and
ownership costs at no charge.&#160;&#160;As a result, these items are not
recorded in the Company&#8217;s consolidated statements of operations.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -1pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Payments based on pre-set
rates</font>:&#160;&#160;Under CPAs, the Company is entitled to receive payments
for each completed block hour and departure and a monthly fixed cost payment
based on the size of its fleet.&#160;&#160;These payments are designed to cover
all of the Company&#8217;s expenses incurred with respect to CPA operations that are
not covered by the reimbursement payments.&#160;&#160;The substantial majority
of these expenses relate to labor costs, ground handling costs in cities where
the partner does not have ground handling operations, landing fees that are not
otherwise specifically reimbursed, overhead and depreciation.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -1pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Margins, mark-up and incentive
payments</font>:&#160;&#160;The Company receives from Delta monthly margin and
mark-up payments related to the CRJ-200 ASA and the CRJ-900 DCA,
respectively.&#160;&#160;For example, the monthly margin payment for the
Company&#8217;s CRJ-200 ASA is calculated based on a target operating margin of 8% on
qualifying expenses.&#160;&#160;The portion of any margin payments attributable
to reimbursement payments will always be equal to the targeted operating margin
for the relevant period.&#160;&#160;However, since the margin pre-set rate
payments are not based on the actual expenses incurred, if actual expenses
differ from these payments, the actual operating margin on CRJ-200 operations
could differ from target operating margin.&#160;&#160;Under the CRJ-900 DCA,
Pinnacle receives monthly mark-up payments calculated as a percentage of certain
expenses.&#160;&#160;Additionally, under the Continental CPA, Colgan is eligible
for certain incentive payments, which are based upon its operating
performance.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Deferred
revenue:</font>&#160;&#160;After Northwest&#8217;s 2005 bankruptcy, the Company and
Northwest entered into an Assumption and Claims Resolution Agreement (the
&#8220;Assumption Agreement&#8221;) on December 15, 2006.&#160;&#160;Under the Assumption
Agreement, Northwest and the Company agreed that the Company would receive an
allowed unsecured claim against Northwest in its bankruptcy
proceedings.&#160;&#160;The Company is recognizing $253,042, the fair value of
its stipulated unsecured claim, over the 11-year term of the CRJ-200
ASA.&#160;&#160;The Company expects to recognize non-cash CRJ-200 ASA-related
revenue of $23,199 per year in the years 2010 &#8211; 2017.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Under the
Company&#8217;s CRJ-900 DCA, the Company defers certain revenue primarily related to
maintenance.&#160;&#160;For example, the Company receives monthly payments based
on contractual rates per departure and block hour for heavy maintenance
activities not expected for at least a year.&#160;&#160;To the extent that the
ultimate maintenance costs incurred are less than amounts collected, the Company
will refund to Delta the excess.&#160;&#160;Conversely, the Company bears the
risk that the maintenance costs incurred exceed the payments generated from the
contractual rates.&#160;&#160;The Company defers the revenue related to these
maintenance deposits, and will recognize the revenue when it performs the
underlying maintenance services.</font></div><br>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">71</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Pinnacle
Airlines Corp.</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Notes
to Consolidated Financial Statements</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(All
amounts in thousands, except per share data)</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div><br>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">3.&#160;&#160;Code-share
Agreements with Partners (Continued)</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
following table includes the deferred revenue components of the Company&#8217;s
CRJ-200 ASA and CRJ-900 DCA with Delta:</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div align="center">
      <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr>
            <td valign="bottom" width="22%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;
      </font></td>
            <td colspan="2" valign="bottom" width="9%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Balance
      at January 1, 2007</font></div>
            </td>
            <td nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px; TEXT-ALIGN: left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
            <td colspan="2" valign="bottom" width="8%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Additions</font></div>
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">During
      </font></div>
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">2007</font></div>

            <td valign="bottom" width="7%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double; TEXT-ALIGN: right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">10,454</font></td>
            <td nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px; TEXT-ALIGN: left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
            <td valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double; TEXT-ALIGN: left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">$</font></td>
            <td valign="bottom" width="8%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double; TEXT-ALIGN: right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">(23,219</font></td>
            <td nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px; TEXT-ALIGN: left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">)</font></td>
            <td valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double; TEXT-ALIGN: left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">$</font></td>
            <td valign="bottom" width="10%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double; TEXT-ALIGN: right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">192,450</font></td>
            <td nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px; TEXT-ALIGN: left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
          </tr></table>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Disputes with Code-share
Partner.</font>&#160;&#160;The Company and Delta are in disagreement over
several contractual items, primarily related to the Company&#8217;s CRJ-200
ASA.&#160;&#160;The Company is in discussions with Delta over the resolution of
these matters, and the status of each item is discussed in further detail
below.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">One
disputed item relates to a one-time adjustment to the Company&#8217;s block hour,
cycle and fixed payment rates under the CRJ-200 ASA that was to become effective
January 1, 2006.&#160; Delta has asserted that the adjustment should have
resulted in a significant decrease in the rates under the CRJ-200
ASA.&#160;&#160;Based on the objection notice that the Company received from
Delta in 2007, the impact of Delta&#8217;s assertion could be a cumulative adjustment
of as much as $11,000 from 2006 through December 31, 2009, and a rate decrease
of approximately $3,000 annually until the next contractually scheduled rate
adjustment on January 1, 2013. The parties have agreed to arbitrate this dispute
if they are unable to successfully resolve this matter.&#160;&#160;No
adjustments have occurred to the Company&#8217;s monthly collections from Delta as a
result of this matter.&#160;&#160;No provision has been recorded in the
consolidated financial statements as the Company does not believe a loss is
probable.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">During
the second half of 2009, Delta also began disputing its obligation to fully
reimburse Pinnacle for its aviation insurance premiums.&#160; During the second
quarter of 2009, Delta requested that Pinnacle exit the Delta aviation insurance
program and independently source its own aviation insurance.&#160; Effective
July 1, 2009, Pinnacle obtained its own independent insurance program at a cost
significantly higher than what it was allocated by Delta under the Delta
insurance program.&#160; Delta has asserted that it is not obligated to
reimburse the full costs of Pinnacle&#8217;s independent insurance program related to
Pinnacle&#8217;s Delta Connection operations and began reducing its monthly payments
to the Company.&#160;&#160;The Company firmly believes that its operating
agreements with Delta require full reimbursement of its actual aviation
insurance premiums.&#160;&#160;The Company is evaluating its potential remedies,
and continues to discuss the matter with Delta.&#160;&#160;In the event the
Company is unable to successfully resolve this matter through discussions, it
may be forced to seek remedy through legal action.&#160;&#160;As a result of
this matter, in the fourth quarter of 2009, the Company did not recognized
revenue for approximately $1,700 of unreimbursed insurance
costs.&#160;&#160;Additionally, the Company has not collected outstanding
accounts receivable relating to this matter of approximately
$1,700.&#160;&#160;No provision has been recorded in the consolidated financial
statements for the possible loss on this receivable from Delta because the
Company believes that it will prevail and consequently no loss is
probable.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Beginning
August 1, 2009, Delta materially altered the payments related to the ground
handling of the Company&#8217;s flights in the majority of the airports where Pinnacle
operates under the CRJ-200 ASA, resulting in a decrease in Pinnacle&#8217;s operating
income for the year ended December 31, 2009 of approximately $820 and a
potential future decrease in annual operating income of approximately $1,100
(subject to fluctuation based on changes in the level of Pinnacle&#8217;s operations
or the cities where Pinnacle flies under the CRJ-200 ASA).&#160; In addition,
Delta asserted that Pinnacle owed Delta a retroactive adjustment related to this
ground handling issue of approximately $4,000. &#160;Pinnacle&#8217;s 2009 ground
handling revenues and expenses were recognized at the lower amounts actually
received from or paid to Delta.&#160;&#160;No provision has been recorded in the
consolidated financial statements for the previously discussed retroactive
adjustment because the Company does not believe a loss is
probable.</font></div><br>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">72</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Pinnacle
Airlines Corp.</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Notes
to Consolidated Financial Statements</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(All
amounts in thousands, except per share data)</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div><br>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">3.&#160;&#160;Code-share
Agreements with Partners (Continued)</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In early
2010, Pinnacle tentatively agreed to accept Delta&#8217;s treatment of ground handling
revenues and costs for all periods after August 1, 2009, without any retroactive
application prior to August 1, 2009.&#160;&#160;Pinnacle and Delta also
tentatively agreed to stipulate the prospective revenue adjustment under a
provision of the CRJ-200 ASA associated with the allocation of Pinnacle&#8217;s
overhead upon the establishment of a certain level of operations outside of the
CRJ-200 ASA.&#160;&#160;The parties tentatively agreed to an annual rate
reduction of $2,000 for 2010 and $2,500 for 2011 and 2012 to satisfy this
provision.&#160;&#160;The parties also tentatively agreed that Delta will
reimburse Pinnacle for the costs related to the change in aircraft livery of
Pinnacle&#8217;s CRJ-200 fleet.&#160;&#160;Finally, as part of the tentative
agreement, Delta agreed to modify the payment terms of some of Pinnacle&#8217;s
airport related costs under certain circumstances in the event Delta request
Pinnacle to operate in different markets in the future.&#160;&#160;These
matters, which would affect the Company&#8217;s financial results beginning in 2010,
are subject to the execution of a binding written agreement, which the parties
are in the process of preparing; however, no assurances can be given that
additional modification to these and other arrangements will not occur in order
to settle these matters with Delta.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Concentration of credit risk:&#160;
</font>As of December 31, 2009, amounts owed from Delta represented 72%, or
approximately $26,000, of the Company&#8217;s accounts receivable balance, which is
uncollateralized.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Related party</font>:&#160;&#160;In
connection with the assumption of the CRJ-200 ASA, the Company entered into a
Stock Purchase Agreement pursuant to which it purchased its Series A Preferred
Share (the &#8220;Preferred Share&#8221;) previously held by Northwest for $20,000 on
January 4, 2008. The Preferred Share had a stated value and liquidation
preference of $100 per share and gave Northwest the right to appoint two
directors to the Company&#8217;s Board of Directors, as well as certain other rights
during the term of the CRJ-200 ASA.&#160;&#160;No dividends were payable to the
shareholder of the Preferred Share.&#160;&#160;Prior to this purchase, Northwest
was considered to be a related party of the Company.&#160;&#160;During the year
ended December 31, 2007, operating revenues and operating expenses of $590,648
and $199,552, respectively, included transactions with Northwest.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Revenue
Pro-Rate Agreements</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
contractual relationships the Company acquired through its purchase of Colgan in
January 2007 included revenue pro-rate code-share agreements, which allow Colgan
to market its operations under its partners&#8217; brands.&#160; Under these
agreements, Colgan generally manages its own inventory of unsold capacity and
sets fare levels in the local markets that it serves.&#160;&#160;Colgan retains
all of the revenue for passengers flying within its local markets that do not
connect to its partners&#8217; flights.&#160;&#160;For connecting passengers, the
passenger fare is pro-rated between Colgan and its major airline partner,
generally based on the distance traveled by the passenger on each segment of the
passenger&#8217;s trip.&#160; Under these agreements, Colgan bears the risk associated
with fares, passenger demand, and competition within its
markets.&#160;&#160;Colgan incurs all of the costs associated with operating
these flights, including those costs typically reimbursed or paid directly by
the major airline under a capacity purchase agreement. In some instances, Colgan
has the ability to earn incentive-based revenue should it achieve specified
performance metrics.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Colgan&#8217;s
financial performance is also subject to seasonal
fluctuations.&#160;&#160;Colgan has historically reported lower unit revenue (as
measured by revenue per available seat mile) during the first and fourth
quarters each year when demand for air travel declines, and reported higher unit
revenue during the second and third quarters each year when air travel demand is
higher.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Continental
Airlines</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">As of
December 31, 2009, the Company, through its Colgan subsidiary, operated 12 Saab
340 aircraft based in Houston, Texas under a pro-rate agreement with Continental
(the &#8220;Continental Agreement&#8221;).&#160;&#160;Colgan entered into the Continental
Agreement in January 2005 for a term of five years.&#160;&#160;In addition to
receiving pro-rated passenger revenue as described above under &#8220;Revenue Pro-Rate
Agreements,&#8221; the Company receives an incentive payment for each passenger
connecting onto or from a Continental flight in Houston.&#160;&#160;These
incentive payments adjust every January 1 and July 1 for anticipated changes in
the cost of fuel and changes in certain station-related costs over the
subsequent six-month period.&#160;&#160;&#160;The Company and Continental are in
discussions to extend and/or modify the terms of the Continental Agreement
beyond its current term, which ends in the summer of 2010.</font></div><br>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">73</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Pinnacle
Airlines Corp.</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Notes
to Consolidated Financial Statements</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(All
amounts in thousands, except per share data)</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div><br>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">3.&#160;&#160;Code-share
Agreements with Partners (Continued)</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">US
Airways</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">As of
December 31, 2009, the Company, through its Colgan subsidiary, operated ten Saab
340 aircraft under a pro-rate agreement with US Airways (the &#8220;US Airways
Agreement&#8221;).&#160;&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff">In 1999, Colgan entered into
the US Airways Agreement to provide passenger service and cargo service under
the name &#8220;US Airways Express.&#8221; The current US Airways Agreement became effective
on October 1, 2005 under terms</font> similar to the 1999 agreement and has a
three-year term.&#160;&#160;The term of the agreement automatically extends in
six-month increments beyond the September 30, 2008 termination date unless
terminated by either party upon 120 days notice.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">United
Air Lines</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">As of
December 31, 2009, the Company, through its Colgan subsidiary, operated 12 Saab
340 aircraft under a code-share agreement with United to provide services as a
United Express carrier (the &#8220;United Agreement&#8221;), which expires on November 1,
2011.&#160; In addition to receiving pro-rated passenger revenue as described
above under &#8220;Revenue Pro-Rate Agreements,&#8221; United pays the Company a set
passenger connect incentive fee for certain of the markets that Colgan operates
under the United Express Agreement.&#160; The passenger connect incentive may
only be adjusted during the three-year term by mutual consent of the
parties.&#160; The Company does have the right, however, to cease serving these
markets to the extent that its operations are not profitable.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Essential
Air Service</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In
addition to the code-share agreements described above, the Company, through its
Colgan subsidiary&#8217;s pro-rate networks, operates under agreements with the DOT to
provide subsidized air service to 11 communities as part of the Essential Air
Service program.&#160;&#160;Colgan operates in three of these markets under its
US Airways Agreement, seven markets under its United Agreement, and one market
under its Continental Agreement.&#160;&#160;Colgan operated in 11 markets under
the EAS program at December 31, 2009.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><a name="FN4">4.&#160;&#160;Segment Reporting</a></font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">During
the year ended December 31, 2007, the Company&#8217;s two reportable segments included
Pinnacle Airlines, Inc. combined with Pinnacle Airlines Corp. (the &#8220;Pinnacle
Segment&#8221;) and Colgan Air, Inc. (the &#8220;Colgan Segment&#8221;). Effective January 1,
2008, the Company revised its reportable segments to reflect a change in the
information used by the chief operating decision maker, and its two operating
segments now consist of the Company&#8217;s two subsidiaries, Pinnacle Airlines, Inc.
(&#8220;Pinnacle&#8221;) and Colgan Air, Inc. (&#8220;Colgan&#8221;).&#160;&#160;Corporate overhead
costs incurred by Pinnacle Airlines Corp. are allocated to the operating costs
of each subsidiary.&#160;&#160;Prior year presentation has been conformed to the
current year presentation.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
following represents the Company&#8217;s segment data for the years ended December 31,
2009, 2008 and 2007.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div align="center">

      Ended December 31, 2009</font></div>
            </td>
            <td nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px; TEXT-ALIGN: left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td valign="bottom" width="36%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;
      </font></td>
            <td colspan="2" valign="bottom" width="16%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Pinnacle
      Segment</font></div>
            </td>
            <td nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px; TEXT-ALIGN: left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
            <td colspan="2" valign="bottom" width="16%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Colgan
      Segment</font></div>

            <td nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
          </tr></table>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>

    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div align="center">
      <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="85%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr>
            <td align="left" valign="top" width="2%">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">(1)</font></div>
            </td>
            <td valign="top" width="70%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">During
      2007, the Board of Directors of the Company authorized a share repurchase
      program, whereby the Company repurchased an aggregate of 4,450 shares of
      its own common stock, of which the weighted average number of shares
      repurchased during the current period are excluded from basic
      EPS.&#160;&#160;The Company accounted for the repurchase of this treasury
      stock using the cost method.</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td valign="top" width="2%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">(2)</font></div>
            </td>
            <td valign="top" width="70%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Options
      to purchase 1,095, 917, and 201 shares of common stock were excluded from
      the diluted EPS calculation at December 31, 2009, 2008 and 2007,
      respectively, because their effect would be
  anti-dilutive.</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr></table>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div><br>

        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Pinnacle
Airlines Corp.</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Notes
to Consolidated Financial Statements</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(All
amounts in thousands, except per share data)</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div><br>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><a name="FN6">6. Investments and Fair Value Measurements</a></font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
Company invests excess cash balances primarily in short-term money market
instruments and overnight repurchase agreements.&#160;&#160;Investments in
marketable securities are classified as available-for-sale and presented at
their estimated fair values based on quoted market prices for those
securities.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Prior to
August 2009, Company&#8217;s investment portfolio consisted primarily of auction rate
securities (&#8220;ARS&#8221;)<font style="DISPLAY: inline; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff">.</font> &#160;In August
2009, the Company reached an agreement to sell its portfolio of ARS to the
financial institution that originally sold the ARS portfolio to the Company (the
&#8220;ARS Settlement&#8221;).&#160;&#160;After repayment of a related credit facility, the
Company received approximately $27,000 in net cash proceeds from this
transaction.&#160;&#160;In addition, the ARS Settlement provides that for a
period of three years from the date of the ARS Settlement, the Company shall
have the right to repurchase all or a portion of the ARS at the same discount to
par the bank paid to the Company under the ARS Settlement (the &#8220;ARS Call
Options&#8221;).&#160;&#160;In November 2009, the Company exercised a portion of the
ARS Call Options.&#160;&#160;The Company received net cash proceeds of $1,288
and recorded a realized gain of $582 as a result of this
transaction.&#160;&#160;The Company determined the fair value of the remaining
ARS Call Options to be $2,723 at December 31, 2009.&#160;&#160;They are
classified as investments on the Company&#8217;s consolidated balance sheet as of
December 31, 2009.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Due to
events in the credit markets that predominantly began during the first quarter
of 2008, there is no longer an active trading market for
ARS.&#160;&#160;Therefore, throughout 2008 and 2009, until the ARS Settlement,
the fair values of the Company&#8217;s ARS were estimated utilizing a discounted cash
flow model.&#160;&#160;This model considered, among other items, the
collateralization underlying the investments, the creditworthiness of the
counterparty, the timing of expected future cash flows, and an estimate of when
the security is expected to have a successful auction or be called by the
issuer.&#160;&#160;These securities were also compared, when possible, to other
observable market data with similar characteristics to the securities held by
the Company.&#160;&#160;As previously discussed, and as a result of the ARS
settlement, the Company&#8217;s balance of ARS as of December 31, 2009 was
$0.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The fair
values of the ARS Call Options were also estimated using a discounted cash flow
model.&#160; The model considered potential changes in yields for securities
with similar characteristics to the underlying ARS and evaluated possible future
refinancing opportunities for the issuers of the ARS.&#160; The analysis then
assessed the likelihood that the options would be exercisable as a result of the
underlying ARS being redeemed or traded in a secondary market at an amount
greater than the exercise price prior to the end of the option
term.&#160;&#160;Future changes in the fair values of the ARS Call Options will
be marked to market through the statement of operations.&#160;</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
tables below present the Company&#8217;s assets and liabilities measured at fair value
as of December 31, 2009, aggregated by the level in the fair value hierarchy
within which those measurements fall.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

        <div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Pinnacle
Airlines Corp.</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Notes
to Consolidated Financial Statements</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(All
amounts in thousands, except per share data)</font></div>

        </div>

    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">6.
Investments and Fair Value Measurements (Continued)</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
following table presents the Company&#8217;s assets and liabilities measured at fair
value on a recurring basis using significant unobservable inputs (Level
3):</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div align="center">
      <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="90%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr>
            <td valign="bottom" width="50%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;
      </font></td>
            <td valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
            <td colspan="6" valign="bottom" width="34%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Asset</font></div>
            </td>
            <td nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid; TEXT-ALIGN: left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td valign="bottom" width="50%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;
      </font></td>
            <td valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>

<tr>
            <td valign="top" width="50%">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: text-top">(1)&#160;&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">The
      Company determines the cost basis for ARS redemptions using the specific
      identification method.</font></font></font></div>
            </td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td valign="top" width="50%">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: text-top">(2)&#160;&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Partial
      redemption of securities at par by the
    issuer.</font></font></font></div>
            </td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td valign="top" width="50%">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: text-top">(3)&#160;&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Proceeds
      received from the sale of the ARS portfolio in connection with the ARS
      Settlement.</font></font></font></div>
            </td>
          </tr></table>

            <td valign="bottom" width="50%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;
      </font></td>

            <td valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double; TEXT-ALIGN: left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">$</font></td>
            <td valign="bottom" width="12%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double; TEXT-ALIGN: right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">592,852</font></td>
          </tr></table>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Senior
Convertible Notes</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In
February 2005, the Company completed the private placement of $121,000 principal
amount of 3.25% senior convertible notes due February 15, 2025 (the "Notes"), of
which $30,979 par amount was outstanding as of December 31, 2009.&#160;&#160;If
certain conditions are met, the Notes are convertible into a combination of cash
and common stock equivalent to the value of 75.6475 shares of the Company&#8217;s
common stock per $1 par amount of Notes, or a conversion price of $13.22 per
share.&#160;&#160;&#160;These conditions were not met as of December 31,
2009.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">On
February 15, 2010, the holders of the Notes exercised their option to require
the Company to purchase all of the remaining outstanding Notes for cash at a
purchase price equal to 100% of their principal amount plus accrued
interest.&#160;&#160;As a result, the entire remaining obligation is shown as a
current liability in the Company&#8217;s consolidated balance sheet as of December 31,
2009.&#160;&#160;As of February 16, 2010, $0 par amount of the Notes was
outstanding.</font></div><br>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">78</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Pinnacle
Airlines Corp.</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Notes
to Consolidated Financial Statements</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(All
amounts in thousands, except per share data)</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div><br>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">7.&#160;&#160;Borrowings
(Continued)</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">New
Accounting Standard</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">A new
accounting standard related to convertible debt became effective for and was
adopted by the Company beginning January 1, 2009.&#160;&#160;This standard
changed the accounting for convertible debt instruments that may be settled in
cash (including partial cash settlement) upon conversion.&#160;&#160;Issuers
must account separately for the liability and equity components of certain
convertible debt instruments in a manner that reflects the issuer's
nonconvertible debt (unsecured debt) borrowing rate when interest cost is
recognized.&#160;&#160;In addition, issuers are required to bifurcate the value
of the convertible instrument upon its issuance into the component that
represented debt and the component that represented the imbedded equity
option.&#160;&#160;The value of the imbedded equity option is reclassified to
additional paid-in capital.&#160;&#160;The resulting discount on the par amount
of the debt is recognized as interest expense in the Company&#8217;s consolidated
statement of operations over the expected term of the debt.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.2pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The new
accounting standard<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;</font>requires
retrospective application to the terms of instruments as they existed for all
periods presented.&#160;&#160;The cumulative effect of the changes in accounting
principle on periods prior to those presented is recognized as of the beginning
of the first period presented with an offsetting adjustment made to the opening
balance of retained earnings for that period.&#160;&#160;As a result, the
Company recorded a net $8,351 reduction to the January 1, 2007 balance of
retained earnings to apply the provisions of the new standard<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;</font>from the
February 15, 2005 issuance date of the Notes.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
Company estimated the fair value of the Notes as of the date of
issuance.&#160;&#160;The difference between the fair value and the principal
amounts of the Notes was $44,046.&#160;&#160;This amount was retrospectively
applied to the Company&#8217;s financial statements from the issuance date, and was
retrospectively recorded as a debt discount and as an increase to additional
paid-in capital, net of tax.&#160;&#160;The discount is being amortized over the
expected five-year life of the Notes resulting in an increase to interest
expense in historical and future periods.<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">&#160;</font>The following
reconciles the Company&#8217;s consolidated statements of operations for the years
ended December 31, 2008 and 2007 and its consolidated balance sheet as of
December 31, 2008, as originally reported to the restated statements contained
in these financial statements.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div align="center">

    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In
January 2009, the Company repurchased $12,000 par value of the Notes for $8,870
plus accrued and unpaid interest.&#160;&#160;The book value of that portion of
the Notes at the time of the repurchase was $10,801.&#160;&#160;In August 2009,
the Company repurchased $78,021 par value of the Notes for $75,000 plus accrued
and unpaid interest.&#160;&#160;The book value of that portion of the Notes at
the time of the repurchase was $74,492.&#160;&#160;As a result of the
repurchase, the Company recorded a gain on debt extinguishment of $2,046 and a
reduction to additional paid-in capital of $523, net of tax, during the year
ended December 31, 2009.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">As a
result of the adoption of the new accounting standard, interest expense
increased by $7,718 for the year ended December 31, 2009.&#160;&#160;Income
before income taxes, net income and EPS decreased by $7,718, $4,666, and $0.25,
respectively, for the year December 31, 2009.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
unamortized discount of the liability component was $383 and $12,563 at December
31, 2009 and December 31, 2008, respectively.&#160;&#160;This discount was
amortized through February 15, 2010.&#160;&#160;The fair value of the Notes as
of December 31, 2009 and 2008 was $29,779 and $80,465,
respectively.</font></div><br>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">80</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Pinnacle
Airlines Corp.</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Notes
to Consolidated Financial Statements</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(All
amounts in thousands, except per share data)</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div><br>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">7.&#160;&#160;Borrowings
(Continued)</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The

    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Credit
Facility</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In March
2008, the Company entered into a revolving term loan (the &#8220;Credit Facility&#8221;)
with a financial institution.&#160;&#160;The Credit Facility provided for
advances up to $60,000 and was collateralized by the Company&#8217;s ARS portfolio.
The Company amended the Credit Facility in June 2008, to increase the eligible
amount for borrowing from $60,000 to $80,000, and again in November 2008 to
increase the eligible amount for borrowing from $80,000 to
$90,000.&#160;&#160;The agreement allowed up to $80,000 of the proceeds to be
used to support the Company&#8217;s aircraft purchases and for general working capital
purposes.&#160;&#160;The remaining $10,000 was restricted for use to retire
other outstanding debt, which the Company used to repurchase $12,000 par value
of the Notes in January 2009 and to repay a portion of its pre-delivery deposit
financing facility as aircraft delivered in December 2008.&#160;&#160;The
Company repaid in full the Credit Facility as a result of the ARS Settlement in
the third quarter 2009.&#160;&#160;See Note 6 for further
discussion.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Line
of Credit</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
Company maintained a revolving line of credit with an institutional lender for a
principal amount not to exceed $8,500 or 75% of the net unpaid balance of
Colgan&#8217;s eligible accounts receivable.&#160;&#160;Amounts outstanding under this
line of credit were $8,275 at December 31, 2008.&#160;&#160;This instrument had
an interest rate of Prime plus 0.25%, which was 3.50% as of December 31,
2008.&#160;&#160;The line of credit expired on April 15, 2009, and the
outstanding balance was paid in full.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Long-Term
Notes Payable</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">As of
December 31, 2009 and 2008, the Company had long-term notes payable of $555,319
and $534,857, respectively.&#160;&#160;Included in long-term notes payable are
borrowings from Export Development Canada (&#8220;EDC&#8221;) for owned aircraft.&#160; The
borrowings are collateralized by the Company&#8217;s fleet of CRJ-900 and Q400
aircraft, which had a net book value of approximately $600,000 as of December
31, 2009, and bear interest at rates ranging between 3.8% and 6.7% with
maturities through the fourth quarter of 2023.&#160;&#160;Amounts outstanding
under these EDC borrowings were $513,462 and $512,575 at December 31, 2009 and
2008, respectively.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The fair
value of the Company&#8217;s long-term notes payable as of December 31, 2009 and 2008
was $482,161 and $483,506, respectively.&#160;&#160;These estimates were based
on either market prices or the discounted amount of future cash flows using the
Company&#8217;s current incremental rate of borrowing for similar
liabilities.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">As
discussed in Note 16, one of the Company&#8217;s Q400 aircraft was destroyed in an
accident on February 12, 2009.&#160;&#160;The insurance proceeds were used to
retire the related debt of approximately $15,400 during the first quarter of
2009.</font></div><br>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
      </div>

Airlines Corp.</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Notes
